page.title: 01NORTH EAST OF SIBBERTOFT
page.content: The four parishes in this rural area of Northamptonshire are chiefly concerned with arable and pastural farming worked by several farms, either privately owned or rented. The main crops that are grown are barley and wheat, with oilseed rape becoming increasingly popular and whose brilliant yellow adds great colour to the undulating countryside. Several herds of Fresian cows are kept for their milk, although beef cattle are also raised. Flocks of Suffilk cross Leicester sheep are also bred. In the woodland areas, the side of an Anglo-Saxon castle, pheasant rearing noiw takes place, in addition to forestry. Other than farmers, the village inhabitants are mainly commuters or retired persons. Most families have their own transport; however, for those who don't, the
